tk.halfgray.pcommandbot

Class CoreCommandResponder

  • java.lang.Object
    • tk.halfgray.pcommandbot.CoreCommandResponder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Responder

    public class CoreCommandResponder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Responder

    Utility to respond to the core command. The core command provides access to internal bot functions. The first part of the argument (before any whitespace) is the subcommand, which determines the function to execute. Any additional information is the subargument. Some subcommands require authentication.

    Currently supported subcommands (case-insensitive):

    • auth: Authenticate with the bot. The subargument is the password.
    • quit: Quit the application (not advised if multiple bots are running in a single application). Requires authentication.
    • join: Join a channel. Requires authentication.
    • part: Part a channel. Requires authentication.
    • time: Output the time in UTC as reported by the system.
    • echo: Reply with the subargument.

      • CoreCommandResponder

        public CoreCommandResponder(java.lang.String pass,
                    PCommandBot b)
        Create a new CoreCommandResponder.
        Parameters:
        pass - Password for authenticating commands, which will be supertrimmed with Utilities.supertrim(String)

    • Method Detail

      • respond

        public java.lang.String respond(java.lang.String channel,
                       java.lang.String user,
                       java.lang.String[] mentions,
                       java.lang.String argument)
        Description copied from interface: Responder
        Respond to a command. For public messages, the users mentioned in the original message will be mentioned in the response automatically. Note that "trimmed" as described in the argument is actually a supertrim, as described in Utilities.supertrim(String).
        Specified by:
        respond in interface Responder
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel from which this message originated (null for private messages)
        user - User from which the command was sent
        mentions - Users mentioned in the original message
        argument - Argument to the command, trimmed
        Returns:
        A response string, or "" to indicate no response (not recommended in most cases)

      • authenticate

        protected boolean authenticate(java.lang.String user,
                   java.lang.String pass)
        Attempt to authenticate the user. If authentication fails, the user who was previously authenticated retains that authentication.
        Parameters:
        user - Username to authenticate
        pass - Password to check
        Returns:
        true if authentication succeeded, false otherwise

      • isAuthenticated

        protected boolean isAuthenticated(java.lang.String user)
        Check if the user is authenticated to perform sensitive functions. If true, the authentication is voided, so that only one sensitive action may be performed with each authentication. (The user may authenticate again.)
        Parameters:
        user - Name of user to check
        Returns:
        true if the user is authenticated, false otherwise
